args: Then I bundle your hair together and...\nThere. Finished.
Aw, it looks GREAT! Thanks, Sazanka!
You are quite welcome. But whatever\nmade you ask me to style your hair?
You are more than capable of creating\nthis look on your own now.
Yeah, but you're better at it than me.\nPlus, having you fiddle with my 'do\nsorta reminds me of old times.
I mean, it's been a while since you\nworked your magic on my noggin.
Yes, it has been some time indeed.\nYou were yet quite small, as I remember.
For me, it brings back memories of how\nwe played together when you used to\ncome to Master Ieyasu's mansion.
You have no idea how worried I was when\nyou up and left here of your own accord.
I am glad the both of you are all right.
Yeah, sorry for worrying you like that.
If anyone ought be apologizing, it is I.
Because I knew information you did not—\nincluding that those who lead the\nWyrmclans have shortened lives.
Yet I chose to prioritize Master Ieyasu's\nfeelings over your own.

I cannot say enough how sorry I am;
I knew you would be hurt, yet did nothing.
Sadly, I did not even do anything to help
Master Ieyasu himself.
He has been a model Wyrmclan leader\nsince he took on the responsibility.
Yet I could not help but notice a tinge of\nloneliness hidden beneath his smile.
Heh. Trying to shoulder every burden\nby his lonesome HAS always been\none of his bad points.
Doubtless that is how he believes\na leader should behave.

But when he chose to bottle up his fears
and doubts, I could do nothing to ease
his suffering. This makes me a true
failure as a retainer.
I could see all of it happening,\nyet did nothing to help.
Hey, I'll be back in a bit, okay?
I'm gonna smack Ieyasu on the head!
You are going to...what?! Botan, wait!
Don't try and stop me! He made you super\nworried, and that is UNFORGIVABLE!
And there's nothing better than a\ndope slap for a dope like that!
Stop this instant, or it is YOU who\nwill be receiving a...um...＂dope slap.＂
I am, of course, pleased that you are so\nconcerned for me, but this is simply a\nconsequence of my own ineptitude.
You must not blame Master Ieyasu.
Yeah, okay—but if I don't blame him,\nthen you don't get to blame yourself!
Because I think respecting his decision\nand just silently watching over him was\nwhat he actually WANTED.
Meanwhile, I was just thinking of myself\nlike a big selfish jerk-o.
Perhaps so—but I think that selfishness\nhelped him more than you realize.
It has been quite some time since\nI last saw him so truly happy.
I owe that to you, Botan.
Oh, please! I just did what my selfish\nlittle heart told me to do.
...Buuuut if that DID end up helping him,\nthen maybe coming after him wasn't\nsuch a bad choice after all.
I am very happy that you did.
Heh. He really is a LOT of work.
Still, since making work for you is\napparently my jam now, can I ask a favor?
Keep an eye on him and make sure he\ndoesn't bottle everything up again.
You're the one who's closest to him,\nso you seem like the right lady for the job.
I'll not let him be burdened\nby sadness ever again.
Aw, I knew I could count on you.
Oh! You're making rice porridge for\ndinner tonight, right?
Lemme help. I need to do SOMETHING\nin return for you helping me!
There is no need for you to thank me.\nAlso, you are not the most...adept of chefs.
Aw, c'mon! How hard can it be?\nJust lemme help, okay? Pleeeease?
Eavesdropping on young women is not\nexactly gentlemanly behavior, Addis.
Yeah, but since you're standin' here,\nI'm guessin' you listened as well.
I did not intend to—I simply\ncould not help myself.
I was not aware that my behavior was\ndistressing the two of them so.
Sazanka's been keepin' peepers\non you for a long time now.
No surprise she'd notice a change.\nYou're lucky to have her.
Hey, and not to take a page outta Botan's\nbook, but keepin' everything to yourself\nain't exactly the best idea in the world.
That's what you got us for.
I shall strive to remember that.
Now, let us go forth and undertake our\nnext trial together: Botan's cooking.
I'm hopin' Sazanka secretly does all\nthe cookin' and throws her stuff out.
I am truly fortunate to have such\nfine retainers and friends.
No man is an island—and indeed,\nI am as mighty as a continent with\nthe three of you at my side.
